skill.name: browsing-with-playwright
skill.description:
Browser automation using Playwright MCP. Navigate websites, fill forms, click elements,
take screenshots, and extract data. Use when tasks require web browsing, form submission,
web scraping, UI testing, or any browser interaction. NOT when only fetching static
content (use curl/wget instead).

security_audit.summary: Legitimate browser automation skill using official Playwright MCP protocol. All network traffic is localhost-only to the MCP server. Scripts manage local process lifecycle. No data exfiltration or external network calls detected.

low_findings.title: Shell command execution in stdio transport
low_findings.description: The mcp-client.py StdioTransport class uses shell=True when spawning subprocess (line 204-212). While used for legitimate MCP server spawning, shell=True can be risky if command input is not properly validated. Code: `subprocess.Popen(self.command, shell=True, stdin=...`

content.value_statement: Web automation tasks require manual navigation and repetitive form filling. This skill provides a Model Context Protocol interface to Playwright, enabling AI assistants to navigate pages, interact with elements, extract data, and take screenshots programmatically.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to URLs and go back/forward in browser history
Take screenshots of pages or specific elements
Fill forms, type text, click buttons, and select dropdown options
Extract page content via accessibility snapshots or JavaScript evaluation
Handle dialogs, hover over elements, and drag and drop
Wait for conditions or execute multi-step Playwright code
limitations: Cannot interact with browser extensions or external apps
Limited to single browser context per session
Does not bypass authentication or access restricted content

use_cases.title: UI testing
use_cases.description: Automate testing workflows by navigating pages, filling forms, and verifying content changes programmatically.

use_cases.title: Web scraping
use_cases.description: Extract structured data from websites by navigating pages and capturing element content.

use_cases.title: Form automation
use_cases.description: Test form submissions and validation by programmatically filling fields and handling dialogs.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate page
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to https://example.com and show me what elements are on the page.

prompt_templates.title: Fill form
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to the login page, take a snapshot to find the form fields, then fill in email and password and submit.

prompt_templates.title: Extract data
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to https://news-site.com and extract all article titles and links from the homepage.

prompt_templates.title: Screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Take a full-page screenshot of https://example.com and save it to example-screenshot.png.

output_examples.input: Navigate to https://example.com and find the submit button
output: ‚úì Element is clickable and ready for interaction

best_practices: Always run browser_snapshot before interacting with page elements to get accurate refs
Use browser_wait_for to handle dynamic content loading
Stop the MCP server when browser work is complete to free resources
anti_patterns: Do not use browser_evaluate to execute untrusted code from external sources
Do not attempt to bypass authentication or access restricted content
Do not leave the server running indefinitely without use

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on macOS, Linux, and Windows with Playwright installed.

faq.question: What are the resource limits?
faq.answer: Browser runs locally on your machine. Resource usage depends on pages loaded and complexity of interactions.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides an MCP interface. Configure your AI tool to connect to localhost:8808 after starting the server.

faq.question: Is my browsing data secure?
faq.answer: All browser activity is local. The MCP server runs on localhost and does not transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why is verification failing?
faq.answer: Ensure Playwright browsers are installed with npx playwright install. Start the server with bash scripts/start-server.sh.

faq.question: How does this compare to puppeteer?
faq.answer: This uses Playwright which offers cross-browser support, better async handling, and the standardized MCP protocol for AI integration.
